title.narrative: Support to Caritas Africa Programme Costs

description.narrative:
Caritas Africa's remit is widespread and varied. Its members are present in 372 Dioceses in sub-Saharan Africa and the number of beneficiaries reached across 31 countries totals around 73 million. However, Caritas member organisations lack financial resources and are seeking ways and means of developing fund raising capacity. Other issues which impact on the work of member organisations include insecurity, inadequate professional skills, the impact of climate change, lack of capacity and reduced donor funding. Caritas Africa's major responsibilities in response to these needs is to ensure regional animation and representation and to facilitate and provide capacity and organisational development for member organisations. In order to do this, Caritas Africa has developed and begun to implement a strategic framework.
This project will provide support to Caritas Africa core costs in order to support the effective implementation of the Strategic framework and the realisation of the 4 main strategic objectives which are outlined in the Caritas Africa Regional Commission road map:
a) Strengthen the Caritas identity to build more effective, collaborative and sustainable social pastoral structures within the Church in Africa b) Reduce the risk and impact of humanitarian crises in Africa in solidarity and compassion with affected communities c) Eradicate extreme poverty and support social services d) Transform inadequate and unjust systems and structures.
CAFOD’s contribution will in particular be used by Caritas Africa for the employment of Desk Officers, Statutory meetings of the Regional Commission and Regional animation, representation, capacity building and organisational development for targeted member organisations.
